Package uansim

Class Channel

java.lang.Object
uansim.Channel
public class Channel
extends java.lang.Object
Author:
Saleh An under-water channel carries acoustic signals from sources to destinations adding ambient noise

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Channel.AmbientNoiseSource
    Represents one source of ambient noise which can be queried to calculate the ambient noise power within a given frequency band.
    static class  Channel.IdealPropagationModel
    The ideal propagation model assumes single path propagation with no path loss.
    static class  Channel.MultisourceAmbientNoise  
    static class  Channel.NodeState  
    static class  Channel.NodeStatistics  
    static class  Channel.PowerDelayProfile
    Power-Delay profile is a representation of the received signal power and delay over multiple paths.
    A tap represents a single copy of the signal over one path, which specifies the delay of the path and its loss (always negative).
    static interface  Channel.PropagationModel
    The propagation model which determines the received signal
    static class  Channel.ShippingNoise  
    static class  Channel.Statistics  
    static class  Channel.ThermalNoise  
    static class  Channel.ThorpPropagationModel
    Thorp's single path propagation model.
    static class  Channel.TurbulenceNoise  
    static class  Channel.WaveNoise

  • Constructor Details

    • Channel

      public Channel()

  • Method Details

    • getPowerDelayProfile

      public Channel.PowerDelayProfile getPowerDelayProfile​(double[] srcPos, double[] dstPos, double[] f)
      Calculates the received signal power-delay profile given the source position, destination position and frequency band. By default the Channel.IdealPropagationModel is used for the calculation. To change the default behavior use setPropagationModel
      Parameters:
      srcPos - coordinates of the transmitted
      dstPos - coordinates of the receiver
      f - frequency band, i.e. f[0] low frequency, f[1] high frequency
      Returns:
      power-delay profile of the received signal

    • getAmbientNoisePower

      public double getAmbientNoisePower​(double[] f)
      Calculates the ambient noise power in the specified frequency band. By default the ambient noise is ignored, and this function returns 0. To change the default behavior use setAmbientNoiseSource.
      Parameters:
      f - frequency band, i.e. f[0] low frequency, f[1] high frequency
      Returns:
      ambient noise power

    • setPropagationModel

      public Channel setPropagationModel​(Channel.PropagationModel propagationModel)
      Specify the propagation model object used for calculating the power-delay profile of received signals
      Parameters:
      propagationModel - PropagationModel object
      Returns:
      this Channel object for chaining

    • setAmbientNoiseSource

      public Channel setAmbientNoiseSource​(Channel.AmbientNoiseSource ambientNoiseSource)
      Specify the ambient noise power calculation function.
      Parameters:
      ambientNoiseSource - an object which implements the getAmbientNoisePower function. See Channel.MultisourceAmbientNoise, Channel.TurbulenceNoise, Channel.ShippingNoise, Channel.WaveNoise, and Channel.ThermalNoise
      Returns:
      this Channel object for chaining

    • addNodes

      public void addNodes​(uansim.Node[] nodes)

    • enableDebug

      public void enableDebug()

    • printStatistics

      public void printStatistics()

    • connect

      public void connect​(uansim.Adapter adapter)
      Connect an adapter to the channel
      Parameters:
      adapter - the adapter to be connected

    • getAdapters

      public java.util.ArrayList<uansim.Adapter> getAdapters()
      Get list of adapters
      Returns:
      list of all nodes connected to the channel

    • getAdapterById

      public uansim.Adapter getAdapterById​(int adapterId)
      Get the (first) connected adapter with the given nodeId
      Parameters:
      nodeId - the node for which the adapter is requested
      Returns:
      the first connected adapter for with the given nodeId or null if no such node exists.
